It sounds more like she's experiencing the rest of the test method not
executing after the first assertion failure.

Nancy - if that is the case, that is the expected behavior.  Read the
FAQ for more information.

=jason

On Fri, 2003-02-28 at 14:40, Scott Stirling wrote: > From: Nancy
[mailto:logmail2003@...]
>
> I am doing unit test(java). in my testcase class, I have
> assertTrue(..). When the condition is false, it suppose to throws
> exception. The problems is: when the condition is false, it just
> silently skip it, and continue to execute the next method. No
> error msg at all. This happens with other assertXXX methods.

Common problem is not having your test methods conform to 'public void
testXXX()', in which case the whole test method will get skipped, not
just
the asserts.  A complete code example would help.

Scott Stirling
